intro: Sebaea saccata, commonly known as the Indian nettle or Indian mullein, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, Africa, and Australia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Sebaea saccata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
